edu.frontrange.csc240.a3.example1

Class Pi

  • Object
    • edu.frontrange.csc240.a3.example1.Pi

  • public class Pi
extends Object
    Prints an estimate of the value of the constant pi obtained by a series expansion to the number of terms given by the user.

    This implementation illustrates a separation of concerns, by having the interaction with the user in one method, and the computation of the needed value in its own method.

    It also illustrates the common technique in the evaluation of series of computing the value of the next term in the series from the previous term. This approach to evaluation minimizes the number of arithmetic operations, and also by the order of arithmetic operations limits the magnitude of the intermediate values needed in the computation.

    Version:
    2016-08-22, CSC-240 Assignment 3, Sample
    Author:
    Dr. Bruce K. Haddon, Instructor

    • Method Detail

      • pi_estimate

        public double pi_estimate(int numberOfTerms)
        Compute the value of pi_estimate, the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter, using Newton's formula as improved by Euler, as accurately as possible to the given number of terms, which is assumed (precondition) to be greater than or equal to 1.

        Each term in the series is approximately half the previous term. By calculating n / (2.0 * n + 1.0) in the form 1.0 / (2.0 + 1.0 / n) the magnitudes of the values of all intermediate expressions are kept small, so there is no risk of overflow, no matter how large is the value of n.

        Parameters:
        numberOfTerms - the number of terms of the Newton/Euler expansion to be used (greater than or equal to 1)
        Returns:
        the the value of pi_estimate, computed as accurately as possible with the given number of terms

      • run

        public void run()
        Perform the tasks of the Pi class. i.e., compute and estimate of the value of the constant π to the input number of terms, and print the results.

        The run method handles the details of the interaction with the user, asking again for input if an unusable value is obtained. Once the number of terms has been successfully obtained, this method delegates to the method that actually performs the computation. The estimate obtained is printed, and a value obtained from the JDK Math class is also printed for comparison.

      • main

        public static void main(String... args)
        Main entry point.

        Execute: 

        java edu.frontrange.csc240.a3.example1.Pi
        Parameters:
        args - not used.
